column4: must just be a bad mp3 or something, i renamed and tried it from another directory, and still errors
oh wait, mpeg adts layer III, is not the same as mp3. i wonder if lame will convert it?
- gnomebaker and serpentine, when i try to burn it to audio cd
it will create a .wav file, which you can then burn to CD
you can also, of course, convert it to mp3 with lame, for "future use"... but you don't have to get an mp3, right?
no just something that will burn to audio cd
yeah, the "-ao pcm" (it will create audiodump.wav, watch out if you happen to have a file with the same name :-) is best
what? It can use mp3s but not wav? This is sad :)
ok, go ahead and use lame to make an mp3... or use something better than gnomebaker :)
- does that '-ao pcm' trick work for streams as well?
I still think that if the CD burners can't use .wav files, it's a bug
